articles.title: Argentina boss Michael Cheika has sly swipe at under-fire Ian Foster after beating All Blacks
articles.description: All Blacks head coach Ian Foster had accused the Pumas of slowing down the speed of the ruck and not releasing players after tackling.
articles.content:
Argentina's head coach Michael Cheika has hit back at New Zealand rugby bosses after his side were accused of 'bending the rules' during their 25-18 win in Christchurch on Saturday.

articles.title: First Person: Sharing indigenous knowledge with tourists
articles.description: After successfully reclaiming her people’s territory in Northern Argentina, Celestina Ábalos turned to tourism to share and promote her indigenous culture.  UN entrepreneurship training during the COVID-19 pandemic helped her business to grow.
articles.content:
After successfully reclaiming her people’s territory in Northern Argentina , Celestina Ábalos turned to tourism to share and promote her indigenous culture. UN entrepreneurship training during the COVID-19 pandemic helped her business to grow.

articles.title: All Blacks sink to embarrassing 119-year first
articles.description: The All Blacks crisis has sunk to new depths after a shock loss to Argentina in New Zealand. Read more here.
articles.content:
All Blacks players look on after their loss to Argentina in the Rugby Championship. Image: Getty
The All Blacks have suffered three-straight losses on home soil for the first time ever after a shock defeat at the hands of Argentina on Saturday.

articles.description: The current and former Australian coaches both celebrated victory over their Southern Hemisphere rivals yesterday,
articles.content:

articles.title: Rugby-Frustrated All Blacks coach blames lack of composure for Argentina loss
articles.description: Foster said the Pumas ability to turn over the ball at the breakdown, and the refereeing of the tackle area, had been a key factor in the loss. "Congratulations to Argentina, they kept true to how they wanted to play, they really frustrated us," he added.
articles.content: All Blacks coach Ian Foster said his team needed to be better at keeping their composure late in matches after they lost to Argentina on home soil for the first time in Christchurch on Saturday. Traditionally strong finishers, New Zealand looked to h... [1993 chars]

articles.title: Rugby-We go again, says delighted Argentina coach Cheika
articles.description: Michael Cheika was clearly delighted with his Argentina team after their maiden victory over the All Blacks in New Zealand on Saturday but said it was vital they were ready to go again against the same opposition in Hamilton next week.
